description: From Middle English idroforbia (“hydrophobia”), from Latin hydrophobia, from Ancient Greek ὑδροφοβία (hudrophobía), from ὑδρο- (hudro-), combining form of ῠ̔́δωρ (húdōr, “water”), + φοβία (phobía, “phobia”). The word is analysable as hydro- +‎ -phobia.

entries.meaning: (pathology) An aversion to water, as a symptom of rabies;  the disease of rabies itself.
(psychology, colloquial) A morbid fear of water; aquaphobia.
